(

; Type locality: Iauae).

— Schillhammer, 1999b: 95 (
Leucitus
; based on original description, species definitely belongs in
Leucitus
; type locality in Java probably erroneous; species probably from New Guinea ; type specimen probably lost).

superbus Arrow, 1915: 499
(
Philonthus
; Type locality: Utakwa , River , Dutch New Guinea ).

Linoderus Sharp, 1885: 452
(species included:
gracilipes
).
TYPE SPECIES:
Linoderus gracilipes Sharp
, fixed by monotypy.
— Blackwelder, 1944: 136 (checklist of species from Mexico , Central and South America, and

gracilipes Sharp, 1885: 452
(
Linoderus
; Type locality: Panama , Volcan de Chiriqui , Bugaba). — Bernhauer and Schubert, 1914: 367 (
Linoderus
; catalog).

,
triseriatus
,
descarpentriesi
,
mongendensis
,
dilutior
,
lampropterus
).

Philonthus triseriatus Bernhauer
, fixed by original designation.

(

Philonthus
; [ Note: Misidentified as
triseriatus
according to Levasseur, 1966: 209]; characters; Belgian Congo ).

Philonthus
; [ Note: Misidentified as
triseriatus
according to Levasseur, 1966: 209]; characters; Belgian Congo ).

Moeocerus Fauvel, 1899: 100
(replacement name for
Homoeocerus Fauvel
).
TYPE SPECIES:
Homoeocerus mimus Fauvel
, fixed by subsequent designation Blackwelder, 1952: 250.

Homoeocerus Fauvel, 1899a: 27
(species included:
mimus
,
simplex
,
ciliatus
,
robustus
,
spinulosus
,
puncticollis
; preoccupied by Burmeister, 1835, and Kolenati, 1859).
TYPE SPECIES:
Homoeocerus mimus Fauvel
by objective synonym with
Moeocerus
for which Blackwelder fixed the type species. [ Note: Blackwelder stated that R. Lucas, 1920: 421, designated the type species but the designation was ambiguous].

Polystictomoeocerus Scheerpeltz, 1977: 145
(subgenus of
Moeocerus
; species included:
puncticollis
,
griseosericans
).
TYPE SPECIES:
Homoeocerus puncticollis Kraatz
, fixed by original designation.

g: 46 (

; Type locality: Abessinien : Harrar ).

(

- DISTRIBUTION: Senegal , Ethiopia , Kenya , South Africa .

; Type locality: Nouvelle-Guinée, Romoi;

Mysolius

aurichalceus
).

chalcopterus Olliff, 1887: 497
(
Mysolius

cupreosplendens Cameron, 1943a: 344
(
Actinus
; Type locality: New Guinea : Milne Bay ).

Neobisnius Ganglbauer, 1895: 464
(species included:
villosulus
;
procerulus
;
prolixus
).
TYPE SPECIES:
Gabrius villosulus Stephens
, fixed by subsequent designation by R. Lucas, 1920: 434.

— Thomson, 1859: 25 (cited as
Bisnius
; [ Note: Thomson’s use of
Bisnius
was a misidentification of
Neobisnius
; Tottenham, 1949 cited it with a type species and as a synonym of
Neobisnius
as though it were an available name]; characters; type species:
cephalotes
).

— Thomson, 1860: 168 (cited as
Bisnius
; [ Note: Thomson’s use of
Bisnius
was a misidentification of
Neobisnius
; Tottenham, 1949 cited it with a type species and as a synonym of
Neobisnius
as though it were an available name]; characters).

— Heyden, 1880: 73 (cited as
Actobius
; list of species of Siberian region).
— Heyden, Reitter, and Weise, 1906: 163 (list of species of Europe and Caucasus).

— Blackwelder, 1943: 440 (synonym of
Erichsonius
; type species:
cinerascens
).
— Gridelli, 1943: 111 (characters; notes; key to a few species).
— Kloet and Hincks, 1945: 165 (list of British species).

— Tottenham, 1949: 371, 417 ( type species:
villosulus Stephens
=
elongatulus Erichson
; checklist of British species).
— V. Hansen, 1952: 29 (characters; key to Danish species).
— Hatch, 1957: 173, 174 (characters; key to species of Pacific Northwest).

— Smetana, 1958: 134 (characters; habitus of one species; type species:
villosulus
; key to Czechoslovakian species).
— Coiffait, 1963: 8, 18 (characters; key to French species groups and included French species).
— Lohse, 1964: 171 (characters; key to central European species).
— Coiffait, 1974: 322 (characters; key to species of western Palaearctic region).
— Frank, 1981: 2 (revision of and key to New World species; characters; checklist of New World species; species group classification).
— Uhlig and Vogler, 1981: 110 (list of some species collected in Germany ; habitat and collecting notes).
— Drugmand 1987b (comments on distribution of Belgian species).
— Silfverberg, 1992: 17 (list of species of Fennoscandia, Denmark , and the Baltic States).
— Smetana, 1993b: 47 (list of species of Czech Republic and Slovakia ).
— M. Hansen, Mahler, Palm, and Pedersen, 1996: 243 (additions to list of Danish species).
— Downie and Arnett, 1996: 374 (characters; key to species of Northeastern North America).
— Lundgren, 1998: 51 (list of species from Florida ; records for other States listed for each species).
— Newton, Thayer, Ashe, and Chandler, 2000: 396 (14 Nearctic species; notes; characters in key).

afghanicus Coiffait, 1979d: 559
(
Neobisnius
; Type locality: entre Camdech et Kouchtous,
1400 à 2000 m
).

(
Neobisnius
; Type locality: Nord-Alai: Fergana; [ Note: See lectotype designation by Gusarov, 1995a]).

(
Neobisnius
; Type locality: Korea : Chejudo , Kyoraeri ).

armuellensis Bierig, 1933: 56
(
Neobisnius
; Type locality: Panama : Puerti Armuelles ).

h: 424 (
